Pre-Game Insights: The match is a do-or-die for India to clinch their second consecutive Intercontinental Cup title.
Manolo Márquez emphasized possession-based attacking football and the importance of a good performance.
Jay Gupta expressed confidence in the team's preparation and belief in coach Manolo Márquez.
José Lana, Syria's coach, highlighted the challenge of India's playing style and focused on improving from their previous performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is effectively the final of the Intercontinental Cup after Mauritius was eliminated.
Others: The match is being played at the GMC Balayogi Athletic Stadium, Hyderabad.
